image.altText: People walking through a washed out street in a town.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 77 per cent of the country is without power after the category five "storm of the century" barrelled through on Tuesday.

title.children: 'That was hell': Hurricane Melissa leaves 25 dead in Haiti, Jamaica devastated

image.altText: An arrangement of 20 different sunscren products on a background of pink bathroom tiles.

props.synopsis: The Australian sunscreen manufacturer at the centre of a spate of recent product recalls has been blocked from exporting sunscreens to the United States for the past three years.

title.children: Sunscreen maker at centre of recalls blocked by US regulator for years

image.altText: The silhouette of a man at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Intelligence insider Peter Williams faces more than a decade in a US jail after pleading guilty to selling a Russian broker his employer's trade secrets.

title.children: Australian who 'betrayed' country, sold Russia secrets

image.altText: Tim Ayres

props.synopsis: The government can't hide its frustration with Rio Tinto but at the same time, it's preparing to dip deeper into taxpayers' pockets to help the company out. Again.

title.children: Labor digging into taxpayers' pockets to bail out Rio Tinto again

image.altText: Childcare regulator

props.synopsis: Despite increasing rates of reporting over the last five years, few investigations have resulted in strong action by the NSW regulator.

title.children: Hundreds of accused childcare workers not punished by regulator

image.altText: Men in dark suits, including Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump, sit at a dinner table with drinks.

props.synopsis: A select group of world leaders have dined with United States President Donald Trump in South Korea, including Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Albanese joins Trump and other leaders for 'special dinner' in South Korea

image.altText: People walk through rubble around a damaged building

props.synopsis: The Israeli military said it would abide by a ceasefire accord in Gaza, as health officials in the enclave said IDF air strikes had killed 104 people.

title.children: Israeli air strikes kill 104 in Gaza, Trump insists ceasefire will hold

image.altText: crypto atm scam victim Dorothy Dyall, Oct 2025

props.synopsis: A pensioner tells her nightmarish story as the financial crimes regulator takes action against a second Australian player in the booming crypto ATM business linked to lucrative scams and money laundering.

title.children: A shocking alarm on her computer sent Dorothy into crypto scam hell

image.altText: Richard Nixon stands among a crowd outdoors, giving his gives his trademark "victory" sign with fingers forming a V shape.

props.synopsis: Richard Nixon did what Kamala Harris wants to. But for her to get to the White House, she is going to have to make tough decisions she has failed to in the past.

title.children: Kamala Harris must tread the Richard Nixon path to the White House

image.altText: A composite image of signage of Australia's 'big four' banks ANZ, Westpac, the Commonwealth Bank and NAB signage

props.synopsis: A shock from the all-important consumer price index has left economists rewriting their rates outlooks, ahead of the Reserve Bank meeting next week.

title.children: Major bank economists rule out November rate cut, review forecasts

image.altText: Concept art of woman working at a computer opposite a robot working at a computer.

props.synopsis: There's an increasing number of tools that block AIs from training themselves on online information. How do they work, and will they change the way AIs and the internet operate?

title.children: 'Cat-and-mouse game': AI is taking content but blockers are fighting back

image.altText: Lynda Henderson aged care

props.synopsis: With major changes to the aged care system looming this week, price hikes for older people accessing support at home could mean their aged care packages will not stretch as far.

title.children: Older people risk losing some at-home services despite 'no worse off' promise

image.altText: A woman looks seriously down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: A woman, who was unable to call triple-0 after men broke into her home while she was in her bedroom, is demanding answers from the telco as calls ramp up for a complete overhaul of the system.

title.children: Woman demands answers after triple-0 calls failed during robbery

image.altText: A cruise ship on the water with an island in the background.

props.synopsis: The death of an 80-year-old woman who was left on a remote tropical island after a cruise stop has reignited debate over passenger safety standards on the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Cruise tragedy sparks calls for tighter safety rules on Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: Murray Watt presser

props.synopsis: Labor will introduce its overhauled environmental protection laws to parliament today, despite opposition to the bill from the Coalition and Greens. Follow live.

title.children: Labor to introduce long-awaited environmental protection bill to parliament

image.altText: Musician Lily Allen struggles with bags of groceries at the front door of a residence

props.synopsis: Lily Allen has dropped her first album in seven years and it is... revealing. We asked Australian artists about turning pain into power, and why break-up songs resonate so deeply with fans.

title.children: Aussie artists on what it's like to share a break-up with the world

image.altText: John Cleese at a kitchen bench next to Prunella Scales during a scene in Fawlty Towers.

props.synopsis: Prunella Scales has been remembered as part of the golden era of British comedy for her numerous roles across film, TV and theatre.

title.children: John Cleese leads tributes to 'perfect' on-screen wife Prunella Scales

image.altText: A new Spirit of Tasmania vessel berthed in Leith in Scotland

props.synopsis: From wharf-less ferries to bungled design specifications costing millions, the troubled Spirit of Tasmania ship replacement project saga just keeps rolling on.

title.children: How Tasmania's ferry operator made a multi-million-dollar mistake

image.altText: A selfie of a young man with a short beard smiling

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen sexual abuse complaints have been made against Tasmanian childcare workers since 2020, most of them by parents.

title.children: 'Matt and I have a secret': The abuse complaints made against Tasmanian childcare workers

image.altText: Peter Cowell in admiral whites and cap.

props.synopsis: Peter Cowell's whereabouts have been unknown since July 2024, but the ABC has tracked him down to suburban Perth.

title.children: 'Fake' Australian admiral discovered a year after vanishing

image.altText: A necklace and earrings on display in a cabinet at the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four hooded thieves made off with the treasures after breaking into the Louvre on the morning of October 19, exposing security lapses at the world's most-visited museum.

title.children: Louvre suspects to be charged with theft and conspiracy, says Paris prosecutor

image.altText: A bombed out window with concrete and glass all over the room.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the attack shows that Russia is the "largest terrorist organisation in the world".

title.children: Russia bombs children's hospital, Vance says Ukraine war will end 'eventually'

image.altText: A batsman wearing blue swings the bat as a wicketkeeper wearing green lunges

props.synopsis: India is left frustrated after rain washed out the men's T20I series opener against Australia at a cold and dreary Manuka Oval.

title.children: Rain washes out first Australia—India T20I in Canberra

image.altText: Laura Wolvaardt raises her bat as she celebrates a century at the World Cup.

props.synopsis: As Australia prepares to play India in the second semifinal, South Africa books its berth in the tournament decider following a commanding performance against England.

title.children: South Africa dominates England to reach World Cup final

image.altText: a teenage girl stands in front of dresses

props.synopsis: The Australian government's ban on social media for children aged under 16 will come into effect in December.

title.children: Entrepreneurs, musicians fear teen social media ban's business impact

image.altText: A man running through a finish line

props.synopsis: Nineteen-year-old Sam Fothergill is now racing against time to qualify for the professional circuit and honour his father through the sport they both love.

title.children: Brisbane teen dedicates world triathlon win to dad battling cancer

image.altText: Two netball players tussle for the ball on the ground.

props.synopsis: The Diamonds's trophy cabinet is again complete after they snapped their New Zealand drought against the Silver Ferns in a thrilling extra-time period to bring the Constellation Cup back to Australia.

title.children: Diamonds defeat Silver Ferns to claim Constellation Cup in extra-time thriller

image.altText: PM joy division shirt

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley stands by her criticism of the prime minister for wearing a Joy Division T-shirt while stepping off a plane last week. Privately, some of her Liberal colleagues are questioning the attack.

title.children: Liberal MPs question Sussan Ley's attack on Albanese's Joy Division shirt

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: Inflation data has came in much hotter than economists were expecting with annual inflation surging to 3.2 per cent in the September quarter, up from 2.1pc in June.

title.children: Inflation 'vastly overshoots' forecasts as prices rise 3.2pc

image.altText: woman smiling sitting on a chair with brown hair in her 30s, with toys in the background

props.synopsis: After battling suicidal thoughts as a new mother, Monique Aulich now supports others going through the same pain.

title.children: Postnatal mental health units still out of reach for many mothers

image.altText: Two police officers are seen from the back, walking through a square.

props.synopsis: UK authorities drop attempted murder trial against a man who stabbed an 11-year-old Australian girl in London in August 2024 on psychiatric grounds.

title.children: Attempted murder trial of man who stabbed 11yo Australian in London dropped

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: DNA evidence could make or break Melbourne’s Easey Street cold case, a court has heard, with the prime suspect denying any involvement in the double murder.

title.children: DNA from 1977 murder scene likely came from prime suspect, court hears

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints

image.altText: Man looking sad at doorway

props.synopsis: More than 100 residents face an uncertain future after a Queensland council votes to end permanent residencies at a holiday park.

title.children: Dozens of homes now 'worthless' after council's van park decision
